bibl.title: Letter from HM. Scheiffelin to Hamilton Fish February 15, 1872
Notes from Liberian Legation In U.S. to Department of State, 1862-1898 T807

div1.p: Legation of Liberia, Yonnkers, N.Y. Feby 15th, 1872

Sir I have the honor of informing you, that I have received from the State Department of Liberia, a communication dated Jany 5th, 1872. informing me tat on the first of the same month the Hon. J.J. Roberts was inaugurated President of Liberia, and expressing the desire fo the Liberian government to maintain the best understanding with the United States government and to strengthen the bonds of friendship which have for so many years subsisted between itself and foreign governments.

I send herewith the said communication for your inspection, as it contains the recogntion, under the new administration, of the commission accord ing me as Chargè d'Affaires. I have the honor to be, Sir, with
the highest consideration. Your obedient servant H.M. Schieffelin To Hon. Hamilton Fish Secretary of State Washington D.C.
